DOC.brief_summary: Study objective : 1 . To compare cardiovascular function old compare young healthy adult . 2 . To compare effect 8 week aerobic interval training vs. continuous moderate exercise cardiovascular function healthy old adult . Hypotheses : 1 . Compared young adult , old adult low cardiovascular function . 2 . Compared continuous moderate intensity exercise training , interval train effective improve cardiovascular function old adult .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Aerobic Interval Training Cardiovascular Function Aging
DOC.detailed_description: Cardiovascular function measure baseline old healthy adult young healthy control . Older adult randomize aerobic interval training group , continuous moderate exercise group non-exercise control group . At end 8-week exercise intervention , baseline measure repeat old adult .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria old adult : Healthy men woman 55 79 year age Sedentary minimally physically active least prior 1 year . Women premenopausal postmenopausal ( either natural surgical ) define cessation menses least 2 year . Premenopausal woman eumenorrheic studied early follicular phase ( day 1 6 ) menstrual cycle . Able give consent . Inclusion Criteria young adult : Healthy men woman 18 35 year age Sedentary minimally physically active least prior 1 year . Women premenopausal , eumenorrheic study early follicular phase ( day 1 6 ) menstrual cycle . Able give consent . history diabetes history relevant cardiovascular disease ( myocardial infarction , angina pectoris , history coronary artery bypass surgery angioplasty , congestive heart failure , arrhythmia ) hypertension ( ≥160 mmHg systolic ≥100 mmHg diastolic ) history renal impairment history gout hyperuricemia history hepatic disease infection hepatitis B , C history seizure , relevant ongoing recurrent illness recent ( within 3 month ) recurrent hospitalization use tobacco product > 5 % weight change prior 6 month . current intake medication may affect study result participation regular aerobic exercise training ( > 30 minute , 3 times/wk past year ) . premenopausal woman take oral contraceptive postmenopausal woman take hormone replacement therapy . pregnancy ( positive urine pregnancy test ) lactation
